flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
stripped_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1 credit more to rez.
text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1[credit] more to rez.
title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
stripped_text: 0 credits: Break 1 barrier subroutine. Use this ability only once per turn.
text: 0[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Place up to 3 advancement counters on 1 unrezzed card in the root of a remote server. Gain 2 credits for each counter placed this way. You cannot access that card for the remainder of the turn.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement counters on 1 unrezzed card in the root of a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each counter placed this way. You cannot access that card for the remainder of the turn.
title: Queen's Gambit

flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
title: Quest Completed

stripped_text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: Retrieval Run

flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
stripped_text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
title: Run Amok

stripped_text: Place 9 credits on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
Place 9[credit] on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it.
stripped_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
title: Cyberfeeder

stripped_text: +1 mu Interrupt -> Whenever you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, instead play or install that card paying 2 credits less. Use this ability only once per turn. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] [interrupt] → Whenever you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, instead play or install that card paying 2[credit] less. Use this ability only once per turn. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Patchwork

flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Corroder

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
title: Datasucker

flavor: It always strikes twice.
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Force of Nature

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
stripped_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access -> Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access → Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Imp

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1 credit. Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Lamprey

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
title: Mimic

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
stripped_text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
title: Ice Carver

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 16 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from this resource.
text:
When you install this resource, load 16[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from this resource.
title: Liberated Account

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
title: Scrubber

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
stripped_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1 credit.
text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1[credit].
title: Xanadu

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
stripped_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2 credits.
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
stripped_text: Install 1 resource from your grip, paying 3 credits less.
text: Install 1 resource from your grip, paying 3[credit] less.
title: Career Fair

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Easy Mark

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
title: Emergency Shutdown

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
title: Hostage

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
stripped_text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
title: Inside Job

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
stripped_text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.
text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.
title: Legwork

flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
stripped_text: Remove 1 tag. Then, you may pay 1 credit to add this event to your grip.
text: Remove 1 tag. Then, you may pay 1[credit] to add this event to your grip.
title: Networking

flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
stripped_text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
title: Spear Phishing

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
stripped_text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Special Order

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
stripped_text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
title: HQ Interface

stripped_text: +1 mu The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1 credit and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1[credit] and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Paragon

flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
title: Abagnale

flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2 credits: +3 strength. trash: Bypass the barrier you are encountering.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass the barrier you are encountering.
title: Demara

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?

text: Interface → 0[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, trash this program.
title: Faerie

text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1[credit] for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
title: Femme Fatale

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

text: [click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
title: Sneakdoor Beta

text:
When you install this resource, load 8[credit] on it. When it is empty, trash it.

title: Bank Job

flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
stripped_text: click, forfeit 1 agenda: Gain 9 credits.
text: [click], forfeit 1 agenda: Gain 9[credit].
title: Data Dealer

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
stripped_text: +1 mu
title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
stripped_text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
stripped_text: Draw 3 cards.
text: Draw 3 cards.
title: Diesel

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars, and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
stripped_text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
title: Modded

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
title: Notoriety

stripped_text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
title: Test Run

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
title: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
stripped_text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
title: Tinkering

flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
stripped_text: +1 mu
title: Akamatsu Mem Chip

stripped_text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Dinosaurus

flavor: Works best at your own desk.
stripped_text: Whenever you breach R&D, access 1 additional card.
text: Whenever you breach R&D, access 1 additional card.
title: R&D Interface

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
stripped_text: When you install this program, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on it. This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 subroutine.
text:
When you install this program, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on it.
This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength.

title: Atman

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Battering Ram

flavor: Didn't see that coming.
stripped_text: Interface -> trash: Break any number of AP subroutines. Interrupt -> trash: Prevent any amount of net damage.
text: Interface → [trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [interrupt] → [trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
title: Deus X

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Gordian Blade

stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3 credits.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3[credit].
title: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
stripped_text: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1 credit on Ice Analyzer. You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
title: Ice Analyzer

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
stripped_text: click: Gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Professional Contacts

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
text: Gain 9[credit].
title: Sure Gamble

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
stripped_text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5 credits.
text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5[credit].
title: Dirty Laundry

stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. click: Place 1 virus counter on this program. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash this program.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. [click]: Place 1 virus counter on this program. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash this program.
title: Crypsis

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.

When you install this resource, load 3 power counters onto it. When it is empty, trash it.

flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."

text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
title: John Masanori

flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."

text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.

Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.

title: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Eli 1.0

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Heimdall 1.0

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. Subroutine Trace[1]. If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed program. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed program. [subroutine] Trace[1]. If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.

flavor: Whrrrrr!

text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Rototurret

flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.

text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine End the run.
text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] End the run.

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
stripped_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
title: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
stripped_text: Gain click click.
text: Gain [click][click].
title: Biotic Labor

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Gain 5 credits and draw 2 cards.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
title: Blue Level Clearance

flavor: "Eyes forward, please."
stripped_text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace 4 if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
stripped_text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses click, if able.
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.
title: Mason Bellamy

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

stripped_text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
title: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

stripped_text: If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives. As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2 credits.
text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
title: Fetal AI

text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.

text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.

text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
title: Project Junebug

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
stripped_text: You can advance this asset. click, trash: Do 3 net damage. Use this ability only if there are 4 or more hosted advancement counters.
text:
You can advance this asset.
[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage. Use this ability only if there are 4 or more hosted advancement counters.
title: Ronin

stripped_text: While the Runner is accessing this card from R&D, they must reveal it. When the Runner accesses this card from anywhere except Archives, you may pay 4 credits. If you do, give the Runner 1 tag and do 3 net damage.
text:
While the Runner is accessing this card from R&D, they must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses this card from anywhere except Archives, you may pay 4[credit]. If you do, give the Runner 1 tag and do 3 net damage.
title: Snare!

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
stripped_text: The first time the Runner spends 1 or more click during their turn, gain 2 credits. If those click were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2 credits. Errata from CR 1.2
text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
title: Sundew

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ. Subroutine End the run.
text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Himitsu-Bako

flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
stripped_text: The strength of this ice cannot be lowered. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The strength of this ice cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Lotus Field

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
stripped_text: Subroutine Do 3 net damage.
text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
title: Neural Katana

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
stripped_text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Trash 1 installed AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Swordsman

flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
stripped_text: Subroutine End the run unless the Corp pays 1 credit. Subroutine Do 1 net damage. Subroutine Do 1 net damage. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Tsurugi

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
stripped_text: Subroutine Do 2 net damage. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Wall of Thorns

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
stripped_text: Subroutine Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Yagura

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2 credits for each card you revealed this way.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card you revealed this way.
title: Celebrity Gift

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
stripped_text: Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn. Do 1 net damage.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.

2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.

flavor: We're ready to start the fire.

flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.

title: Project Beale

flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"

flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.

flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"

flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
stripped_text: You can advance this ice. It gets +1 strength for each hosted advancement counter. Subroutine End the run.
text:
You can advance this ice. It gets +1 strength for each hosted advancement counter.

title: Ice Wall

flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru

text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

title: Spiderweb

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Beanstalk Royalties

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
